Based on global literature, most government-led national cash transfer programs provide direct cash transfers to impoverished households[4][9]. Some government-led programs have incorporated elements of the 'graduation' model, which includes multi-component support such as productive asset transfer, training, and coaching, but this is not standard for all such programs[1][2][3]. Cash is a common component, but provision of productive assets is typical only of programs explicitly adopting a graduation approach[2].
